body_html:
I also got the "ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found." error with Python 3.6.1 (CPython, not Anaconda) and Christoph Gohlke's May 3 version of TensorFlow-GPU (tensorflow_gpu‑1.1.0‑cp36‑cp36m‑win_amd64.whl). Followed advice from a number of places on the Net and tried reinstalling MSVC 2015 x64 redist, etc. without success.
Finally ==> replaced cuDNN 5.1 with 6.0 and everything just magically worked! Give it a try and it might work for you.
body_text:
I also got the "ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found." error with Python 3.6.1 (CPython, not Anaconda) and Christoph Gohlke's May 3 version of TensorFlow-GPU (tensorflow_gpu‑1.1.0‑cp36‑cp36m‑win_amd64.whl). Finally ==> replaced cuDNN 5.1 with 6.0 and everything just magically worked! Give it a try and it might work for you.
body:
I also got the "ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found." error with Python 3.6.1 (CPython, not Anaconda) and Christoph Gohlke's May 3 version of TensorFlow-GPU (tensorflow_gpu‑1.1.0‑cp36‑cp36m‑win_amd64.whl). Followed advice from a number of places on the Net and tried reinstalling MSVC 2015 x64 redist, etc. without success.
Finally ==> replaced cuDNN 5.1 with 6.0 and everything just magically worked! Give it a try and it might work for you.
